intro: [WRONG START] Gelonia ivorense, commonly known as the Ivory Coast gelonia, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant. Its leaves are typically glossy and oval-shaped, adding to its ornamental value.
